name: vestige_006: smol pulse of the Dead God
description: In 1994, a single unit of Dead God Pulse (called a 'smol') was isolated and stably stored (and four redundant copies were later created), becoming known as the International Prototype of the Dead God Pulse (IPDGP), the standard of the unit of DGP strength for the metric system, and remained so until 2019. The smol was the first of the Dead God SI units to be defined by a crypto-physical artefact. The smol is now defined in terms of the second, the Planck length, and anomaly-observer interaction rate, basing it on mostly-fixed fundamental constants of nature. This allows a properly-equipped metrology laboratory to calibrate a DGP measurement instrument such as a Pico8 sensory-neomodulator as the primary standard to determine an exact smol intensity, although the IPKGP and other precision smol intensities remain in use as secondary standards for all ordinary purposes.
